basic.description: Students are exposed to an in-depth study of selected topics in neuroendocrinology and neuroendocrine techniques. Neuroendocrinology refers to the neural control of endocrine and autonomic function. Areas of focus will include CNS control of cardiovascular function, reproduction, and appetite. In addition, students will learn to critically evaluate scientific literature. Instructional format is primarily student- led seminars. (Offered odd years; jointly with PHGY-494).  Winter. D. Van Vugt. PREREQUISITE: PHGY-214 or equivalent.   EXCLUSIONS: PHGY-894*, PHGY-494.
basic.subject: BMED
basic.title: Neuroendocrinology
